## Getting Started

### Install & Load Libraries

The code chunk below installs and launches the tidyverse, ggdist, ggridges, colourspace & ggthemes packages into R environment


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman:: p_load(tidyverse, ggdist, ggridges,
                colourspace, ggthemes)
```
:::


### Importing the data

The code chunk below imports exam_data.csv into R environment by using read_csv() function of readr package, which is part of the tidyverse package.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


## Histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(
    color = "#1696d2",
  )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Probability Density plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_density(
    color = "#1696d2",
    adjust = .65,
    alpha = .6
  )           
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Alternative design


ggplot(data=exam_df, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_density(
    color = "#1696d2",
    adjust = .65,
    alpha = .6
  ) +
  stat_function(
    fun = dnorm, args = list(mean = mean_eng,
                             sd = std_eng),
    col = "grey30",
    size = .8
  ) +
  geom_vline(
    aes(xintercept = mean_eng),
    colour="4d5887",
    linewidth = .6,
    linetype = "dashed"
    ) +
  annotate(geom = "text",
           x = mean_eng - 8,
           y = 0.04,
           label = paste)

## Visualising Distribution with Ridgeline Plot

### Plotting ridgeline graph: ggridges method


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS)) +
  geom_density_ridges(
    scale = 3,
    rel_min_height = 0.01,
    bandwidth = 3.4,
    fill = colorspace::lighten("#7097BB", .3),
    color = "white"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    name = "English grades",
    expand = c(0, 0)
    ) +
  scale_y_discrete(name = NULL, expand = expansion(add = c(0.2, 2.6))) +
  theme_ridges()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Varying fill colors along the x axis


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS,
           fill = stat(x))) +
  geom_density_ridges_gradient(
    scale = 3,
    rel_min_height = 0.01) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Temp. [F]",
                       option = "C") +
  scale_x_continuous(
    name = "English grades",
    expand = c(0, 0)
  ) +
  scale_y_discrete(name = NULL, expand = expansion(add = c(0.2, 2.6))) +
  theme_ridges()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Mapping the probabilities directly onto colour


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam,
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS, 
           fill = 0.5 - abs(0.5-stat(ecdf)))) +
  stat_density_ridges(geom = "density_ridges_gradient", 
                      calc_ecdf = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Tail probability",
                       direction = -1) +
  theme_ridges()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Ridgeline plots with quantile lines


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam,
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS, 
           fill = factor(stat(quantile))
           )) +
  stat_density_ridges(
    geom = "density_ridges_gradient",
    calc_ecdf = TRUE, 
    quantiles = 4,
    quantile_lines = TRUE) +
  scale_fill_viridis_d(name = "Quartiles") +
  theme_ridges()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam,
       aes(x = ENGLISH, 
           y = CLASS, 
           fill = factor(stat(quantile))
           )) +
  stat_density_ridges(
    geom = "density_ridges_gradient",
    calc_ecdf = TRUE, 
    quantiles = c(0.025, 0.975)
    ) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    name = "Probability",
    values = c("#FF0000A0", "#A0A0A0A0", "#0000FFA0"),
    labels = c("(0, 0.025]", "(0.025, 0.975]", "(0.975, 1]")
  ) +
  theme_ridges()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Visualising Distribution with Raincloud Plot

### Plotting a Half Eye graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Adding the boxplot with geom_boxplot()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .20,
               outlier.shape = NA)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

### Adding the Dot Plots with stat_dots()


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .20,
               outlier.shape = NA) +
  stat_dots(side = "left", 
            justification = 1.2, 
            binwidth = .5,
            dotsize = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Finishing touch


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(exam, 
       aes(x = RACE, 
           y = ENGLISH)) +
  stat_halfeye(adjust = 0.5,
               justification = -0.2,
               .width = 0,
               point_colour = NA) +
  geom_boxplot(width = .20,
               outlier.shape = NA) +
  stat_dots(side = "left", 
            justification = 1.2, 
            binwidth = .5,
            dotsize = 1.5) +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_economist()
```
